Package com.inrupt.client.uma

Interface ClaimGatheringHandler

  • public interface ClaimGatheringHandler
    A handler capable of gathering claims for a given type, from a given issuer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      ClaimToken gather()
      Gather a claim token.
      CompletionStage<ClaimToken> gatherAsync()
      Gather a claim token asynchronously.
      String getClaimTokenFormat()
      Get the claim token format supported by this handler.
      String getClaimType()
      Get the claim type supported by this handler.
      String getIssuer()
      Get the issuer supported by this handler.
      default boolean isCompatibleWith​(RequiredClaims requirements)
      Determine if this handler is compatible with the listed UMA requirements.

    • Method Detail

      • getClaimTokenFormat

        String getClaimTokenFormat()
        Get the claim token format supported by this handler.
        Returns:
        the supported claim token format

      • getIssuer

        String getIssuer()
        Get the issuer supported by this handler.
        Returns:
        the supported issuer

      • getClaimType

        String getClaimType()
        Get the claim type supported by this handler.
        Returns:
        the supported claim type

      • gather

        ClaimToken gather()
        Gather a claim token.
        Returns:
        a new claim token for use with the UMA claims gathering interaction

      • gatherAsync

        CompletionStage<ClaimToken> gatherAsync()
        Gather a claim token asynchronously.
        Returns:
        the next stage of completion containing a new claim token

      • isCompatibleWith

        default boolean isCompatibleWith​(RequiredClaims requirements)
        Determine if this handler is compatible with the listed UMA requirements.
        Parameters:
        requirements - the requirements for an interaction to proceed
        Returns:
        true if this handler is compatible with the described requirements; false otherwise
